page.title: 17RELIGION - BRACEBY
page.content: Braceby has 1 church - St. Margaret (CofE) in the Ropsley group parish. Rector Rev. B. Foster, Churchwardens E.Pellew- Harvey, Mrs B. Limb. After years of neglect following a big drop in population, this 13th C. building was very dilapidated & in 1972 was about to be made redundant. Then a doubling of population occurred and the village revived. By the enthusiasm and hard work of everyone the church was restored. Braceby shares a parson with 4 other parishes & has 2 services a month, (Holy Communion & Family Service alternating) with special ser- vices for church festivals including Blessing the Lambs on Shepherds Sunday - average attendance over the year is 10 from a population of 31. Two bells dated l275 & l590 rehung this year(see photo). Members of other faiths have to travel to nearby towns to worship.
